children.name: a place that you are not in now
there
examples: ▪ I love Italy - I worked there for a year.
▪ Jackie’s arriving at the station at 3.15 and I said I’d meet her there.
▪ When I came home Sean was just sitting there waiting for me.
▪ We drove down to Baltimore, and on the way there we stopped for lunch.
right thereexactly there
▪ Where’s my umbrella? I’m sure I left it right there, next to my bag.
from there
▪ We flew in to Munich and from there we took the train to Prague.
down/up/in etc there
▪ How did you get up there on the roof

children.name: that place
children.definition: a place that you have mentioned or been in, especially a place that you feel strongly about:
examples: Nơi đó
▪ You went to Camp Chippewa too? I hated that place.
Bạn cũng đã đến Trại Chippewa? Tôi ghét nơi đó.
in that place
Trong nơi đó
▪ They’ll never let us back in that place after the way you behaved.
Họ sẽ không bao giờ để chúng tôi trở lại nơi đó theo cách bạn cư xử.
to that place
Đến nơi đó
▪ Do you remember we went down to that place along the river and had a barbecue?
Bạn có nhớ chúng tôi đã xuống nơi đó dọc theo dòng sông và đã có một bữa tiệc nướng không?

children.name: over there
children.definition: in a place that you can see or point to but cannot touch:
examples: ▪ My car’s over there by that big tree.
▪ See those rocks over there? Be careful to keep the boat away from them.

children.name: around there
children.definition: around/near therealso round there British   in the area near a place you have been talking about:

children.name: Xung quanh, gần đây
examples: ▪ We usually go to Lake Como for our holidays - it’s beautiful round there.
Chúng tôi thường đi đến Hồ Como cho những ngày nghỉ của chúng tôi - nó thật đẹp quanh đó.
▪ Judy’s looking for an apartment in Greenwich Village. A lot of her friends live around there.
Judy đang tìm kiếm một căn hộ tại Greenwich Village. Rất nhiều người bạn của cô ấy sống ở đó.
▪ One of the largest tornadoes ever seen was photographed near there.
Một trong những cơn lốc xoáy lớn nhất từng được nhìn thấy được chụp gần đó.

children.name: to not be here or there
not be here
children.definition: không còn ở đây, không được ở đây
examples: ▪ How would she know what happened? She wasn’t even here.
▪ Why aren’t the scissors here where they belong?
▪ The supermarket hasn’t been here long but it’s already doing a lot of business.

children.name: not be around
children.definition: if someone or something is not around they are not here or anywhere in this area, especially when they are needed: không ở đây
examples: ▪ If Julie isn’t around, maybe Maria could help you.
▪ Every time I want to talk to Ted, he’s not around.
▪ Why isn’t there ever a taxi around when you need one?
▪ Maybe you should try talking to Michael when his wife isn’t around.
▪ According to Caroline, Larry isn’t around much since he started traveling for work.

children.name: be out
children.definition: /not be inB1  to not be in your home, the place where you work etc for a short time, especially when sb wants to see you: không ở đây, có đó, ra ngoài
examples: ▪ Sally phoned while you were out. I told her to phone back later.
▪ Mr Rogers isn’t in at the moment. Can I help you?
▪ I’m going to be out all afternoon.
▪ I’m so busy. If anyone calls for me, tell them I’m not in.

children.name: not be there
examples: ▪ She says the bottle is in the cupboard, but it just isn’t there.
▪ He was supposed to wait for me by the fountain, but he wasn’t there when I arrived.

children.name: be away
children.definition: to not be at home, school, or work for several days or weeks, because you are travelling or staying somewhere else: vắng mặt , đi xa
examples: ▪ ‘We’re taking a trip to California.’ ‘Oh, how long do you plan to be away?’
be away from
▪ My job requires me to be away from home for five months of the year.
be away on business
▪ While Kurt was away on business, his wife completely redecorated the house.

children.name: absent
children.definition: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to goOPP present
examples: According to the personnel department you have been absent twice this week already.
be absent from
James was absent from school again today.
students who are regularly absent from school
Register
In everyday English, if sb is on holiday or on a business trip, people usually say that he/sheis away:
He'sawayat the moment. He’s gone to Hawaii.
If you want to say that sb is not in a particular place, saynot there:
I called in to see her but shewasn't there.
If you want to say that sb is not with you, saynot here:
I'm afraid he'snot hereat the moment. Can I take a message?

children.name: be off
children.definition: if someone is off, they are not at work, usually because they are ill or on holiday. In British English you can also use this when sb is not at school: nghỉ phép
examples: ▪ I’ll be off all next week, so I can do some of the yard work then.

children.name: be off with
examples: ▪ Becky’s been off for several days with a bad back.

children.name: be off sick
examples: ▪ Chris has been off sick a lot lately.

children.name: be off school/workBritish
examples: ▪ Jenkins isn’t off school again, is he? What’s his excuse this time?

children.name: to be in a place where you are now
tới đây, đến đây
examples: ▪ Check the names off the list to make sure everyone is here.

children.name: ▪ ‘Have you seen the can opener anywhere?’ ‘Yes, it’s here on the counter.’
examples: ▪ I’m not going out - I want to be here when Tony arrives.
▪ The monument has been here since 1876.

children.name: be in
children.definition: to be in your home, the place where you work etc, especially when you areexpected to be there: ở đây, có đó, có thể ở trong
examples: Hello Mrs Baxter. Is Mark in?
Sonia won’t be in today - she’s not feeling very well.
You can go out for a while but make sure you’re in by 11 o'clock.

children.name: be present
children.definition: to be here, especially because you are expected or have planned to be here: có mặt ở đây
examples: ▪ The teacher keeps a daily record of who is present.
▪ The President was not able to be present for the ceremony.

children.name: those presentthe people here
examples: ▪ Among those present were several film and television stars.

children.name: be around
children.definition: if sb/sth is around, they are here or somewhere in this area, especially when they are needed: có thể quanh đây
examples: Chuck must be around - I just saw him a few minutes ago.
Are you going to be around at Christmas or are you going on holiday?
Yesterday’s newspaper must still be around somewhere.

children.name: to be at an event where you aren't now
Ở đó
examples: ▪ What was the game like? Were there many people there?
Trò chơi như thế nào? Có nhiều người ở đó không?
▪ I went to a party last night and your sister was there too.
Tôi đã đi dự tiệc đêm qua và em gái của bạn cũng ở đó.
▪ A lot of the people at the charity event were only there to look at other people.
Rất nhiều người trong sự kiện từ thiện chỉ có ở đó để xem những người khác.

children.name: be at
children.definition: if someone is at a particular event, they are there in order to see or hear it.
examples: ▪ Most of the actors in the movie were at the New York preview.
▪ I don’t remember Uncle Bob. I don’t think he was at the funeral.
▪ Were you at the meeting when they announced the layoffs?

children.name: be present
children.definition: if someone is present at a special or official event, they are there, especially because it is important that they should see what is happening:
examples: ▪ The only people who were present for the ceremony were the bride and groom, the priest, and two witnesses.

children.name: be present at/for
examples: ▪ It was very important to Jim to be present for the birth of his first child.

children.name: those presentthe people there
examples: ▪ Those present at the trial said that the accused looked cheerful.

children.name: be on the scene
children.definition: to be in the place where something such as an accident or crime has happened: có mặt tại hiện trường
examples: ▪ Journalists were on the scene within minutes of the plane crash.

children.name: ▪ A Safety Board team was on the scene Monday morning to try to determine the cause of the accident
be in attendance
children.definition: to be at a special or important event, especially in order to take part in it:
examples: ▪ Over 2000 police were in attendance at yesterday’s demonstration.
▪ The First Lady was in attendance for most of the conference sessions.
▪ He always enjoyed going to Stewart’s parties where famous people were sure to be in attendance.

children.name: be on the spot
children.definition: especially UK to be in the place where something very interesting or exciting happens: có mặt
examples: ▪ I’m going to the stadium. I want to be on the spot when they announce the international team.
▪ Many reporters, in an attempt to be on the spot in war time, have ended up being killed.

children.name: to be in a place where you aren't now
be there
children.definition: Be there
examples: Ở đây
▪ ‘Have you seen the newspaper?’ ‘It’s there, next to your chair.’
'Bạn đã xem tờ báo chưa?' 'Nó ở đó, cạnh cái ghế của bạn.'
▪ I want to be there when he comes out of surgery.
Tôi muốn ở đó khi anh ta ra khỏi cuộc giải phẫu.
▪ When I worked at the factory, I was there every day from nine till six.
Khi tôi làm việc tại nhà máy, tôi ở đó mỗi ngày từ chín đến sáu tuổi.
be down/up/in etc there
Ở dưới/ trên/ trong đây
▪ The bathroom’s up there, on your right.
Phòng tắm nằm ở đó, bên phải của bạn.

children.name: be around
children.definition: if someone or something is around, you know that they are there but you are not sure exactly where:
examples: ▪I tried to call you last night, but I guess you weren’t around
▪ Go and look downstairs. There must be a coffee machine around somewhere
▪ It doesn’t matter if no one is around - I’m still not going through a red light..

children.name: be in
children.definition: to be in your home, the place where you work etc, especially when you are expected to be:

children.name: ▪ Is Marsha in? I have a letter for her
examples: ▪ I’ll phone back later when Mr Boswell is in.
▪ I walked over to Sonia’s house but when I got there only her brother was in.

children.name: be present
children.definition: if a substance is present somewhere, it is there even though you cannot see it: có, tồn tại
examples: ▪ When acid is present, the chemical in the test tube turns red.

children.name: be present in
examples: ▪ The virus is present in tears and saliva, but in very small amounts.
▪ Tests revealed that large quantities of alcohol were present in the driver’s blood.

children.name: here
children.definition: in or to the place where you are: đây, ở đây, ở chỗ này
examples: ▪ We’ve lived here for over a year now.
▪ I’ll stay here and wait for the others.
▪ I love it here - it’s so quiet and peaceful near the ocean.
around here/round here/near herenear this place
▪ Did you grow up around here?
▪ I think Jeff lives somewhere near here.right here
in this exact place
▪ The keys were right here 15 minutes ago. Where did they go?
from herefrom this place
▪ I know a good Japanese restaurant not far from here.
down/in/up etc here
▪ ‘Where are you?’ ‘I’m down here in the basement.’
get/come/move etc here
▪ They got here about 15 minutes before you did.

children.name: in this place
children.definition: in the place where you are now, especially a place that you like or dislike: ở nơi này, tại đây
examples: I’m sick of living in this place - there’s nothing to do.
It’s impossible to find a decent restaurant in this place.

children.name: on this spot
children.definition: on this (very) spot in the place where you are standing, especially a place where something very important happened in the past: tại địa điểm này
examples: It was on this very spot that President Kennedy was assassinated.
It’s exciting to think that so many great men and women have made speeches on this spot.

children.name: make your presence felt
children.definition: makeyourpresence felt

children.name: to have a strong effect on other people or on a situation
examples: _The new police chief has really made his presence felt.

children.name: all over somewhere
children.definition: all oversomewhere

children.name: everywhere in a particular place
examples: _Soon the news was all over town.

children.name: to sb's face
children.definition: tosb'sface

children.name: If you say something unpleasant to someone's face, you say it to them directly, when you are with them
examples: _If you've got something to say, say it to my face.

children.name: in front of
children.definition: where someone can see or hear you
examples: _Please don't swear in front of the children.

children.name: presence
children.definition: when sb/sth is present in a particular placeOPP absence:
examples: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.

children.name: indicate the presence of sb/sth
examples: These plants indicate the presence of underground water.

children.name: reveal the presence of sb/sth
examples: Excavations revealed the presence of an ancient burial ground.

children.name: detect the presence of sb/sth
examples: They invented a device for detecting the presence of submarines.

children.name: confirm the presence of sb/sth
examples: Tests confirmed the presence of an infection.

children.name: explain the presence of sb/sth
examples: How could he possibly explain the presence of so much money in his flat?

children.name: notice somebody's presence
examples: If he had noticed her presence, he gave no sign.

children.name: sense somebody's presence
children.definition: be aware that someone is present without seeing them
examples: The man sensed his presence at once and turned sharply.

children.name: acknowledge somebody's presence
children.definition: speak to someone or make a sign to show that you know they are present
examples: He acknowledged my presence with a quick wave.

children.name: be/become aware of sb’s presence
examples: It was only when I coughed that he became aware of my presence.

children.name: presence of
examples: Tests revealed the presence of poison in the blood.

children.name: presence
children.definition: noun
examples: [ S ] a group of police or soldiers who are watching or controlling a situation
_The United Nations has maintained a
presence in the region for some time.
_There was a strong police
presence at the demonstration.
